content: Switched the 4th test case with the validator, that checks whether the occupation time is taken into account, several people made a mistake of adding the occupation time to the distance time and got 100% on tests, but not on validators

The tests and validators don't match.

I've missundestood that the time is calculated by adding travel tiem and occupation time and this work for 100% of the tests but only 25% of the validators.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It's a bit challenging to solve it in under five minutes, would depend on the language used, but is doable.

It is nicely explained, not hard, but also not simple. Quite a nice little puzzle. Of course, depending on the language, it's going to be quite challenging to be the shortest, but I guess it goes with the territory. Done in C.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Really interesting, nice story but quite challenging to do it under 5 minutes. Would really love to see it in easy puzzle but doable under the 15 minutes of a CoC. The example in the introduction helped but is not easily readable (maybe use a list).

Overall : challenging, good validators, good examples. 
Solved in C++.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It is quite challenging but doable within 5 minutes. It could be simplified a little bit to make it fit perfectly within the time frame but seems reasonable to me for now
I'd suggest adding upper bounds for the tests constraints, apart from that, great ! I would actually see that as a *long* clash of code if the text is shortened a little bit, perhaps.
I think it's too long for clash of code - it would take a couple minutes only to read the statement, nevermind actually solving the problem.
Funny exercise! I am making this comment just to get the achievement. But I mean it though...

Goal and Output section
* You may format the possible fixed output phrase as a {{constant}} and remove the quotation marks around it.

Constraints section
* Please change "dist" to "distance" for consistency.

Cases
* The first test and the first validator are the same. Please change them so that they are different.

Thanks.
Thanks, good remarks, I have changed all parts accordingly.

Frankly, I agree with you. At the moment of making that clash I was in the mode of 'lets make a nice story', but after some more weeks of playing clashes myself, I discover that during the stress of clash playing a story is quite annoying and time-consuming.

I am thinking about either rewriting (shortening) it for clash, upgrading it a bit to turn it into a puzzle, or forget it all together. I've not made my decision yet.
Perhaps a simplification would be to remove the possibility to have 2 toilets equally good. That would make it fit more easily within the 5 min (which I was very close to personally)

Thanks - as per the below comments I have simplified the statement and overall clash:
- There is not any more a situation of multiple best toilets;
- The statement text is shortened, and I have removed all [[variable]] syntax from the <<for example>>, to make it easier on the eyes.
I also added an upper bound for the test constraint, like you suggested.
Thanks for the feedback; I've edited the example a bit, I hope it improved readability.

Hmm apologies - I always hate it when during a Clash validators mismatch the test cases, apologies that I apparently have done that to you. I have no idea what happens when I edit an already approved clash though, let me check into that.
Whoops this one I totally forgot - thanks a lot for making this change. The remark already came three months ago and I promised to check it - but I totally forgot.
No worries man, besides that, the clash was pretty noice ;)
Thank you ! It seems better from my point of view

Thanks for the positive feedback - despite your approval on the current version I will simplify the clash following your suggestions, as well as by shortening the writing style a bit. And when it does not get two more approvals, I'll rewrite it towards a puzzle as per the conversation with Koarla below here.
i think it would be great as a puzzle, and i really love the story element! please do resubmit as a puzzle :)
